warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Extend one arm overhead, bending at the elbow.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Gently pull the elbow towards the head with the other hand, holding for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Extend arms forward at shoulder height.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate wrists clockwise for 30 seconds, then counterclockwise for 30 seconds.
Jumping jacks or high knees for 1 minute to increase blood flow.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Extend your arms fully overhead, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly lower the weight by bending your elbows.
4. Pause briefly at the bottom, feeling the stretch in your triceps.
5. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form but challenges you on the last 2-3 reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Use an EZ bar or straight bar. Lie on a bench with the bar overhead.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Lie on a bench holding an EZ bar or straight bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Extend your arms fully overhead, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly lower the bar towards your forehead, bending your elbows.
4. Pause briefly at the bottom, feeling the stretch in your triceps.
5. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, focusing on a controlled movement and full range of motion.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Avoid swinging the weight or using momentum.

exercises.setup: Use an EZ bar or straight bar. Lie on a bench with the bar overhead.
execution: 1. Lie on a bench holding an EZ bar or straight bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Extend your arms fully overhead, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
3. Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly lower the bar towards your forehead, bending your elbows.
4. Pause briefly at the bottom, feeling the stretch in your triceps.
5. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, focusing on a controlled movement and full range of motion.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to a high pulley.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand facing the machine, grip the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body.
3. Extend your arms fully, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Slowly lower the bar by bending your elbows.
5. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, maintaining a controlled movement and full range of motion.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Keep your elbows tucked in close to your sides.

exercises.setup: Attach a straight bar to a high pulley.
execution: 1. Stand facing the machine, grip the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body.
3. Extend your arms fully, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Slowly lower the bar by bending your elbows.
5. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 reps with good form, focusing on controlled movement and full range of motion.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with a narrow grip on the barbell, slightly closer than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Grip the barbell with a narrow, overhand grip, slightly closer than shoulder-width.
3. Lower the bar to your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
4. Push the bar back up to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 reps with good form, maintaining a controlled movement and full range of motion.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on controlled movement and avoid using momentum. Keep your elbows close to your body throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Use a cable machine with a low pulley.
execution: 1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the cable handle with one hand, keeping your elbow close to your side.
3. Keeping your upper arm stationary, extend your forearm back, squeezing your triceps at the top.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, feeling the stretch in your triceps.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 15 reps with good form, focusing on a controlled movement and full range of motion.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on the mind-muscle connection and feel the contraction in your triceps. Avoid using momentum.
